intro: Hemizonia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hemizonia corymbosa thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
